author: R Vimal Kumar
text:
A group of micro and small-scale manufacturers and traders joined hands to float a political party – ‘Gandhi Desiya Munnetra Kazhagam’ – here on Sunday to use it as a platform to air their grievances.

The party, however, will not contest the coming Assembly elections. Around 1,000 manufactures and traders joined the party as members.

At a function here, the party’s flag with Mahatma Gandhi’s image was unveiled. A majority of members were micro and small-scale manufacturers.

The party was founded by K.S. Babuji, a Tirupur-based textile businessman and general secretary of Small cotton shirt and Inner wear Small-Scale Manufacturers Association (SISMA).

He told The Hindu that he had been toying with the idea of floating the party for the past two years as grievances of micro and small-scale manufacturers would be better heard if aired from a political platform.
title: Traders float new party
